skill.name: prometheus-configuration
skill.description: Set up Prometheus for comprehensive metric collection, storage, and monitoring of infrastructure and applications. Use when implementing metrics collection, setting up monitoring infrastructure, or configuring alerting systems.
skill.summary: Set up Prometheus for comprehensive metric collection, storage, and monitoring of infrastructure and...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: The skill is documentation only and contains configuration examples. No executable code, data access, or network behavior is present in this directory.

content.value_statement: Prometheus setup is complex and easy to misconfigure. This skill provides clear examples for scraping, rules, and validation.
actual_capabilities: Provide Helm installation steps for Kubernetes deployments
Provide Docker Compose setup for Prometheus
Show a full prometheus.yml example with scrape configs
Provide recording rule examples for common service metrics
Provide alert rule examples with labels and annotations
List promtool validation commands for configs and rules
limitations: Does not execute commands or validate configurations
Does not include the referenced template or script files
Does not connect to Prometheus or read live metrics
Does not generate Grafana dashboards or SLOs

use_cases.title: Bootstrap monitoring stack
use_cases.description: Deploy Prometheus with Helm and apply a baseline configuration for a new cluster.

use_cases.title: Define alert coverage
use_cases.description: Draft alert rules for availability, latency, and resource usage with clear labels.

use_cases.title: Expose application metrics
use_cases.description: Add a scrape job for application endpoints with TLS settings and labels.

prompt_templates.title: Basic config
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a simple prometheus.yml with one scrape job for my app and explain the key fields.

prompt_templates.title: Recording rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Create recording rules for request rate, error rate, and p95 latency with clear metric names.

prompt_templates.title: Alert rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft alert rules for service down, high error rate, and high latency with labels and annotations.

prompt_templates.title: Kubernetes scrape
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a scrape_config for Kubernetes pods using prometheus.io annotations and relabeling.

output_examples.input: Create alert rules for high CPU and low disk space.
output: High CPU alert fires after 5 minutes above 80 percent usage.
Low disk alert fires after 5 minutes above 90 percent usage.
Each alert includes severity labels and a short summary.

best_practices: Validate configs and rules with promtool before deployment
Set scrape intervals that match system load and retention
Use recording rules for expensive PromQL queries
anti_patterns: Scraping too frequently without storage planning
Using alerts without clear labels and annotations
Skipping recording rules for complex dashboards

faq.question: Is this compatible with Kubernetes and Docker?
faq.answer: Yes. It includes Helm and Docker Compose examples for Prometheus.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: It provides examples only and does not run commands or validate files.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Grafana or Alertmanager?
faq.answer: It shows Alertmanager targets and assumes Grafana for visualization.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No. It is documentation only and does not access files or networks.

faq.question: What if promtool reports errors?
faq.answer: Check YAML syntax, file paths, and rule expressions for typos.

faq.question: How does this compare to generic guides?
faq.answer: It focuses on actionable configuration patterns and ready examples.
